eea.engine.component
Class Component

java.lang.Object
  eea.engine.component.Component
Direct Known Subclasses:
Event, RenderComponent
public abstract class Component
extends java.lang.Object

A Component is an abstract element that has a ID and an owner. Components can be updated using the update(GameContainer, StateBasedGame, int) method.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Alexander Jandousek, Timo Bähr

          the internal ID of this component

          the internal owner entity of this component

getOwnerEntity

public Entity getOwnerEntity()
returns the entity that "owns" this component

Returns:
the entity that "own" this component and is thus associated with it, as well as affected by events on the component.

setOwnerEntity

public void setOwnerEntity(Entity owningEntity)
Assigns the entity that "owns" this component

Parameters:
owningEntity - the entity that "owns" the component, (which is associated with the component and thus affected by events thereon)

update

public abstract void update(org.newdawn.slick.GameContainer gc,
                            org.newdawn.slick.state.StateBasedGame sb,
                            int delta)
All components have to provide the update method. This method updates the component based on GameContainer and the StateBasedGame instance that represents the current game state

Parameters:
gc - the GameContainer object that handles the game loop, recording of the frame rate, and managing the input system
sb - the StateBasedGame that isolates different stages of the game (e.g., menu, ingame, highscores etc.) into different states so they can be easily managed and maintained.
delta - the time passed in nanoseconds (ns) since the start of the event, used to interpolate the current target position
